title: Question for Rioters: Summoner Name vs Real Life Name
body:
I'm wondering, around the workplace (and, really, everywhere), do you often refer to each other by your summoner names, or by your birth names? Are there certain places where you tend to use one more than the other (email/forums/face-to-face/etc)?

Cheers,  
Hyrum Graff

@Forum Frequenters (Baconhawk, BuboBubo, Whist, etc)

replies.body:
Most Rioters and nearly all players call me Ghostcrawler or GC. I've only called myself that on forums or in games (and NEVER IN BARS TO IMPRESS LADIES DESPITE WHAT YOU MAY HAVE HEARD.)

I call most Rioters by their real names because I haven't made all of the summoner name connections yet.

actually... I've been meaning to tell you. We all have another name for you when you're not around. I'll tell you about it some time. ;)

(I kid, I kid! <3)
I can see the pick up line now "Hey baby, if you want to moan like a ghost let's crawl into bed"

It can occasionally be useful when two people have the same name and work frequently together to have the option of switching back and forth. I had a meeting last week where we decided that for the duration of the meeting (since he shared the same first name as another person in the room) that we would call Morello "Morello".

In general, though, my experience is the same as Whist's, of everyone using their real names. When I first was getting my bearings, I would sometimes ask where, for example, CertainlyT sat, and people would stare blankly at me, since everyone knows him by his real name.

"(since he shared the same first name as another person in the room) that we would call Morello "Morello"."

You mean there's someone else at Riot who's named Nerfmaster Sucktown?

Rofl.

True story: When I first met him, I greeted Morello affectionately as Nerfmaster Sucktown. He laughed.
This, this makes me want to work at Riot.
XD

It kinda depends.

Few people call me Whist, most people call me Tom.
The people who don't actually know me but need to talk to me about something call me Thomas (because that's what the name tag at my work area says)


In the Art Department we really just call each other by our real names (sometimes last names because multiple people have the same first name).
Let's say if you were at some sort of Riot press conference, would you prefer to be called by your real name or by Whist?

In the office, I call everyone by their actual name.

Anywhere else, I call everyone by their Riot handle.

That's just me, though. I'm just extra sensitive to some people's desire for privacy, and if I'm not 100% sure of their preference I just call them by their Riot handle.

up-boated because of Slumber Jack's name.

Such brilliance.
I've generally seen Rioters use real names with each other, although in game or on the forums, its more clear when using Red Names.

> I've generally seen Rioters use real names with each other, 

That's kind of what I expected (although, I had a little hope that perhaps there was a company in which people would call each other NeuroCat and Baconhawk in passing conversation),

>although in game or on the forums, its more clear when using Red Names.

and this is the reason why I was curious.
It is partly true - I regularly call Firetiger by his summoner name in meetings and stuff. Cuz...how could I not?

Everyone calls me Bacon. 

I call everyone #Baconflock

Much love and sizzling

I call most Rioters by their real name, though I tend to call Baconhawk "bacon" from time to time and I refer to Ghostcrawler in the third person as "GC or Ghostcrawler" to other Rioters because when I use his real name half the time they look confused for a second or two. Myself, most folks call me "J." or "Jeckert" (my first initial plus last name), though there is one or two who on occasion who call med "Sarg". (Short G, not at all like "Sarge") 

Ironically, outside of work, more friends call me Sarg than not, but then again I've used Sargonas since 1996 soooo it's kinda stuck, heh.

In either case I happily answer to either equally without complaint.

So I guess there are two takeaways here:

1. Work, life and gaming all blend to create an environment where we are comfortable calling each other just about any name

2. I am called Bacon and have therefore transcended humanity

/fin

> 2. I am called Bacon and have therefore transcended humanity

Bacon (Bacons?) are people too!

edit: whoa, the above quote's plain text reads as follows (without the quotes):

"> 2. I am called Bacon and have therefore transcended humanity"
be thank im not a rioter, i would call you Sargent.

This is kind of related. 

Is there a list of all the Riot staff Red names somewhere? 

I just enjoy seeing the often punny names people come up with for themselves.
My last name is Kartman, so you can imagine that everyone wants to call me Kartman at work, at home, everywhere. -_-
